text: I know that large tuples are slow but I don’t really know _why_. Anyone that can perhaps explain the why or knows a good reference maybe?

elements.text: I know that large tuples are slow but I don’t really know
. Anyone that can perhaps explain the why or knows a good reference maybe?

text: Basically because a tuple have one type param per element, so the compiler chokes very quickly. Operating on a 250-element tuple is like a type with 250 parameters.

elements.text: Basically because a tuple have one type param per element, so the compiler chokes very quickly. Operating on a 250-element tuple is like a type with 250 parameters.

text: It seems like something that should be fixed at some point, so that we can have true NTuples

elements.text: It seems like something that should be fixed at some point, so that we can have true NTuples

text: To clarify, the *compiler* is slow with long tuple, the generated code can typically be very performant.

elements.text: is slow with long tuple, the generated code can typically be very performant.

text: Isn't there also some threshhold where the compiler stops optimizing if the tuples get too big?

elements.text: Isn't there also some threshhold where the compiler stops optimizing if the tuples get too big?
